title: Astronauts Come Home Early from Space Station for Health
summary: NASA has decided to bring four astronauts home early from the International Space Station because one of them had a medical problem. The astronaut is safe and stable, but NASA wants to be extra careful. The astronauts are part of Crew-11, which includes Commander Zena Cardman, Pilot Mike Fincke, and others from Japan and Russia. They will return to Earth in their SpaceX Crew Dragon spacecraft, landing in the Pacific Ocean. NASA is not sharing details about the medical issue to protect the astronaut's privacy. The crew is well-trained to help each other in emergencies, and the space station has medical equipment. This shows that astronaut health is NASA's top priority.

What is NASA's top priority according to the article?

background_read: The International Space Station is a home in space where astronauts from different countries work together. NASA is the United States space agency that sends people to space. Astronauts train for years to handle emergencies, and they have medical tools on the station. When someone gets sick, NASA makes careful decisions to keep everyone safe.
Article_Structure: WHO: NASA officials and the Crew-11 astronauts, including Commander Zena Cardman and Pilot Mike Fincke.
WHAT: NASA is bringing four astronauts home early from the International Space Station due to a medical issue with one crew member.
WHERE: The International Space Station in space, with a planned landing in the Pacific Ocean off California.
WHY: To ensure the health and safety of the astronauts, as NASA prioritizes their well-being and is being cautious.

perspectives.description: NASA is acting carefully to protect astronauts, showing that health is more important than missions.
